thread.title: Man allegedly assaulted Domino's workers after being denied pizza
thread.title_full: Man allegedly assaulted Domino's workers after being denied pizza

title: Man allegedly assaulted Domino's workers after being denied pizza
text:
Man allegedly assaulted Domino’s workers after being denied pizza By 9NEWS 
A man has allegedly assaulted two workers in a scuffle over pizza at a Sydney fast-food shop. 
Police were called to reports of an assault at a Domino’s Pizza shop on Canterbury Road at Dulwich Hill at 12.15am today. 
CCTV video from the shop shows two male workers speaking with a third man in the shop, before he allegedly attacked them. 
The man demanded pizza and was asked to leave, 9NEWS understands. 
When he was refused service he allegedly assaulted both workers, aged 23 and 30. The man allegedly demanded pizza. (9NEWS) 
One worker, aged 23, suffered a swollen cheek and the other, aged 30, was treated by paramedics for a suspected broken nose. He was later taken to the Royal Prince Alfred Hospital. 
A 26-year-old man was arrested at the shop and is assisting police with inquiries. 
Police said he was allegedly intoxicated at the time of his arrest. © Nine Digital Pty Ltd 2017
